links.*: The Tale of Aragorn and Arwen

wikitext.*:
{{Main|Timeline}} == [[Fourth Age]] == {|class="wikitable" |- ! '''[[Fourth Age|Fo.A.]]''' !! '''[[Shire Calendar|S.R.]]''' !! '''Events''' |- |- | [[Fourth Age 1|1]] || 1422 || The Fourth Age begins in the reckoning of the Shire.{{App|Chief}} ''Possible'' birth of [[Eldarion]], son of King [[Aragorn|Elessar]] and Queen [[Arwen]].{{NM|P1xi}}, p. 78This precise date is still uncertain, since the text from which it derives puts the date of Eldarion's death on {{FoA|125}} and was written by Tolkien in [[1959]] thus predating the second edition of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', where Tolkien ultimately changed the date of [[Aragorn|Aragorn's]] death from {{FoA|100}} to {{FoA|120}}. |- | [[Fourth Age 2|2]] || 1423 || Death of [[Adelard Took]].{{App|C2}} Birth of [[Frodo Gardner]].{{App|C4}} |- | [[Fourth Age 4|4]] || 1425 || Birth of [[Rose Gardner]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 6|6]] || 1427 || [[Will Whitfoot]] resigns and [[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]] is elected Mayor.{{App|B5}} [[Merry Gardner]] born. [[Peregrin Took]] marries [[Diamond of Long Cleeve]].
'''King [[Aragorn|Elessar]] issues an edict that [[Men]] are not to enter the [[Drúadan Forest]] and [[The Shire|Shire]], and he makes it a Free Land under the protection of the Northern Sceptre.''' |- | [[Fourth Age 7|7]] || 1428 || Death of [[Gaffer Gamgee]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 8|8]] || 1429 || Birth of [[Pippin Gardner]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 9|9]] || 1430 || Birth of [[Faramir Took I]] son of [[Peregrin Took]]. Deaths of [[Merimac Brandybuck]] and [[Vigo Boffin]].{{App|C6}} |- | [[Fourth Age 10|10]] || 1431 || Birth of [[Goldilocks Gardner]]. Death of [[Odovacar Bolger]].{{App|C5}} |- | [[Fourth Age 11|11]] || 1432 || Death of the [[Saradoc Brandybuck]].{{App|C3}} Meriadoc becomes [[Master of Buckland]] and great gifts are sent to him by King [[Éomer]] and Lady [[Éowyn]] of [[Ithilien]]. Birth of [[Hamfast Gardner]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 12|12]] || 1433 || Birth of [[Daisy Gardner]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 13|13]] || 1434 || Death of [[Paladin Took II]]. [[Peregrin Took]] becomes the [[Thain]] and King [[Aragorn|Elessar]] makes the Thain, the Master of Buckland and the Mayor to be Counsellors of the North-kingdom. [[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]] elected Mayor for the second time. |- | [[Fourth Age 14|14]] || 1435 || Death of [[Olo Proudfoot]].{{App|C1}} Birth of [[Primrose Gardner]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 15|15]] || 1436 || King [[Aragorn|Elessar]] rides north and dwells for a while in [[Annúminas]] by [[Lake Evendim]]. He comes to the [[Brandywine Bridge]], and there greets his friends. He gives the [[Star of the Dúnedain]] to Master [[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]], and [[Elanor Gardner|Elanor]] is made a maid of honour to Queen [[Arwen]].
Death of [[Glóin]]. Birth of [[Bilbo Gardner]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 17|17]] || 1438 || Birth of [[Ruby Gardner]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 19|19]] || 1440 || Birth of [[Robin Gardner]]. Death of [[Farmer Cotton]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 20|20]] || 1441 || [[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]] elected Mayor for the third time. |- | [[Fourth Age 21|21]] || 1442 || [[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]], [[Rose Cotton|Rose]] and [[Elanor Gardner|Elanor]] ride to [[Gondor]]; Master [[Tolman Cotton Junior|Tolman Cotton]] acts as deputy Mayor. Birth of [[Tolman Gardner]]. |- |[[Fourth Age 22|22]] || 1443 || [[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]], [[Rose Cotton|Rose]] and [[Elanor Gardner|Elanor]] leave [[Gondor]]. Death of [[Filibert Bolger]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 27|27]] || 1448 || [[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]] elected Mayor for the fourth time. |- | [[Fourth Age 30|30]] || 1451 || [[Elanor Gardner]] weds [[Fastred of Greenholm]] on the Far Downs. |- | [[Fourth Age 31|31]] || 1452 || '''The [[Westmarch]] becomes a part of [[the Shire]] by the gift of the King. Many hobbits move to it.''' |- | [[Fourth Age 33|33]] || 1454 || Birth of [[Elfstan Fairbairn]] son of Fastred and Elanor. |- | [[Fourth Age 34|34]] || 1455 || Death of [[Imrahil]]. [[Elphir]] becomes [[Prince of Dol Amroth]].
Fastred and Elanor make their dwelling at [[Undertowers]] on the Tower Hills, where their descendants, the [[Fairbairn Family|Fairbairns of the Towers]], dwell for many generations.
[[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]] elected Mayor for the fifth time. At his request the [[Thain]] makes Fastred [[Warden of Westmarch]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 41|41]] || 1462 || Birth of [[Holfast Gardner]].
[[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]] elected Mayor for the sixth time. |- | [[Fourth Age 42|42]] || 1463 || [[Faramir Took I]] weds [[Goldilocks Gardner]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 48|48]] || 1469 || [[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]] becomes Mayor for seventh and final time. |- | [[Fourth Age 55|55]] || 1476 || [[Samwise Gamgee]] ends his seventh and last term as [[Mayor of Michel Delving]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 61|61]] || 1482 || Death of [[Rose Cotton|Rose Gamgee]] on Midyear's Day.
'''On [[22 September]] [[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]] rides out from [[Bag End]] and he comes to the [[Tower Hills]], where he is last seen by [[Elanor]]. He gives her the [[Red Book]] afterwards kept by the [[Fairbairn Family|Fairbairns]]. Samwise passes the Towers, goes to the [[Grey Havens]] and passes over the [[Belegaer|Sea]], last of the Ring-bearers.''' |- | [[Fourth Age 63|63]] || 1484 || [[Peregrin Took]] commissions a copy of the original [[Red Book|Red Book of the Periannath]], later known as the [[Thain's Book]], at the request of King Elessar. [[Meriadoc Brandybuck]] and Peregrin depart from [[the Shire]] and travel south carrying the book. [[Faramir Took I]] succeeds his father Peregrin as [[Thain]] of [[the Shire]]. Meriadoc comes to [[Edoras]] and is with King [[Éomer]] before he dies in the autumn. Meriadoc and Peregrin come to [[Gondor]] and pass what short years are left to them in that realm, until they die and are laid in [[Rath Dínen]] among the great of [[Gondor]].
[[Elfwine]] becomes [[King of Rohan]].{{App|A2}} |- | [[Fourth Age 67|67]] || 1488 || Death of Prince [[Elphir]]. [[Alphros]] becomes [[Prince of Dol Amroth]]. |- | [[Fourth Age 80|80]] || 1501 || Birth of [[Harding of the Hill]] (Harding Gardner), [[Samwise Gamgee]]'s great-grandson and the last head of the [[Gardner Family]] named in the histories. |- | [[Fourth Age 82|82]] || 1503 || Death of [[Faramir]].{{App|South}} [[Elboron]] becomes [[Prince of Ithilien]] and Steward of the [[Reunited Kingdom]].{{PM|Elendil}}, p. 221 |- | [[Fourth Age 91|91]] || 1512 || Death of [[Dwalin]] at 340 years of age.{{App|A3}} |- | [[Fourth Age 95|95]] || 1516 || Death of [[Alphros]].{{PM|Elendil}}, p 223 |- | [[Fourth Age 120|120]] || 1541 || '''[[1 March]]: King [[Aragorn|Elessar]] dies. It is said that the beds of Meriadoc and Peregrin are set beside the bed of the great king. [[Eldarion]] becomes King of the Reunited Kingdom.'''
'''[[Legolas]] builds a grey ship in [[Ithilien]], and with [[Gimli]] sails down [[Anduin]] and so over the [[Belegaer|Sea]]. End in [[Middle-earth]] of the [[Fellowship of the Ring]].''' |- | [[Fourth Age 121|121]] || 1542 || Death of [[Arwen|Arwen Undómiel]] in [[Lothlórien|Lórien]].{{App|Tale}} |- | [[Fourth Age 171|171]] || 1592 || A copy of the [[Thain's Book]] is completed in [[Minas Tirith]] by [[Findegil]], the [[King's Writer]]; probably commissioned by an unnamed great-grandson of Peregrin Took. The copy is sent to the Shire, where it is kept in the library at [[Great Smials]]. |- | ''After
171'' || ''After
1592'' || '''[[Durin VII]] is born, grows to adulthood, and retakes [[Khazad-dûm]] for the Dwarves of [[Durin's Folk]].''' |- | [[Fourth Age 185|185]] || 1606 || Death of [[Harding of the Hill]].{{PM|Trees}}{{rp|115}} |- | c. [[Fourth Age 220|220]] || c. 1641 || Some "secret societies" emerge in [[Gondor]] "practising [[Dark Tree|dark cults]], and '[[Orcs|orc-cults]]' among adolescents".{{L|338}} This "secret [[Morgoth|Satanistic]] religion" is later discovered and overthrown in Gondor.{{L|256}} '''About this time, [[Eldarion|Eldarion's]] reign as [[High King (Dúnedain)|High King]] comes to an end.'''{{L|338}} |- | ''Unknown'' || || '''[[Celeborn]], [[Círdan]], and any other Elves in Middle-earth who remember the [[First Age]] depart the Grey Havens on the [[Last Ship]].'''{{FR|Records}} |} {{references|notes}}
